body: Could you run `make VERBOSE=1` to see what flags are being passed to the compiler? Or `make -n` if that doesn't work.

make VERBOSE=1:

(base) [b1jeong@k8s-u200-01 build]$ make VERBOSE=1
/usr/local/bin/cmake -S/home/b1jeong/glfw -B/home/b1jeong/glfw/build --check-build-system CMakeFiles/Makefile.cmake 0
/usr/local/bin/cmake -E cmake_progress_start /home/b1jeong/glfw/build/CMakeFiles /home/b1jeong/glfw/build/CMakeFiles/progress.marks
make -f CMakeFiles/Makefile2 all
make[1]: Entering directory `/home/b1jeong/glfw/build'
make -f src/CMakeFiles/glfw.dir/build.make src/CMakeFiles/glfw.dir/depend
make[2]: Entering directory `/home/b1jeong/glfw/build'
cd /home/b1jeong/glfw/build && /usr/local/bin/cmake -E cmake_depends "Unix Makefiles" /home/b1jeong/glfw /home/b1jeong/glfw/src /home/b1jeong/glfw/build /home/b1jeong/glfw/build/src /home/b1jeong/glfw/build/src/CMakeFiles/glfw.dir/DependInfo.cmake --color=
make[2]: Leaving directory `/home/b1jeong/glfw/build'
make -f src/CMakeFiles/glfw.dir/build.make src/CMakeFiles/glfw.dir/build
make[2]: Entering directory `/home/b1jeong/glfw/build'
[  1%] Building C object src/CMakeFiles/glfw.dir/x11_init.c.o
cd /home/b1jeong/glfw/build/src && /bin/cc -D_GLFW_USE_CONFIG_H -I/home/b1jeong/glfw/include -I/home/b1jeong/glfw/src -I/home/b1jeong/glfw/build/src  -fPIC   -Wall -o CMakeFiles/glfw.dir/x11_init.c.o   -c /home/b1jeong/glfw/src/x11_init.c

Thanks.

`/bin/cc -D_GLFW_USE_CONFIG_H -I/home/b1jeong/glfw/include -I/home/b1jeong/glfw/src -I/home/b1jeong/glfw/build/src -fPIC -Wall -o CMakeFiles/glfw.dir/x11_init.c.o -c /home/b1jeong/glfw/src/x11_init.c`

It looks as though CMake isn't specifying a C standard (e.g. `-std=c99`), so the compiler's default is being used (probably `gnu90` for your compiler, whereas it would be `gnu11` on more recent releases).

IMO we should definitely add a C standard to the build line to avoid this kind of issue. Can someone who speaks CMake look into that?

issue.title: Added a CMake line to select C99 in the implementation

repository.name: glfw
repository.description: A multi-platform library for OpenGL, OpenGL ES, Vulkan, window and input

issue.body:
This tells CMake to select the C99 standard in a compiler/platform agnostic way.

It should fix issue #1560

body: @byungheon-jeong @tombsar I created a pull request to fix that, but I don't currently have the setup to test it. Can someone try my patch to see if everything works as it should? Thanks.

issue.title: error: ‘for’ loop initial declarations are only allowed in C99 mode

repository.name: fyne
repository.description: Cross platform GUI toolkit in Go inspired by Material Design

issue.body:
### Describe the bug:
# fyne.io/fyne/vendor/github.com/go-gl/glfw/v3.3/glfw
In file included from ../../fyne.io/fyne/vendor/github.com/go-gl/glfw/v3.3/glfw/c_glfw_linbsd.go:14:0:
../../fyne.io/fyne/vendor/github.com/go-gl/glfw/v3.3/glfw/glfw/src/x11_monitor.c: In function ‘getModeInfo’:
../../fyne.io/fyne/vendor/github.com/go-gl/glfw/v3.3/glfw/glfw/src/x11_monitor.c:59:5: error: ‘for’ loop initial declarations are only allowed in C99 mode


### To Reproduce:
Steps to reproduce the behaviour:
1. Go to '1.14'
2. Click on '....'
3. Scroll down to '....'
4. See error

### Screenshots:
<!-- If applicable, add screenshots to help explain your problem. -->


### Example code:
<!-- If applicable, add a short code snippet to help explain and simplify reproduction of the problem. -->
<!-- Please write the code inside a code block with go syntax, like this:
```go
Write your code here.
```
-->


### Device (please complete the following information):
 - OS: [linux centos]
 - Version: [7.5]
 - Go version: [e.g. 1.14.0]
 - Fyne version: [e.g. 1.2.0 or git SHA]

This PR is to add the same patch to the owl library.
